newsitem.title: USA: Penultimate buys PenWare in reverse merger.
newsitem.headline: Penultimate buys PenWare in reverse merger.

text.p: PenUltimate Inc said Monday it has acquired Sunnyvale-based PenWare Inc through a reverse merger in which PenWare shareholders now own roughly 90 percent of the reorganized company.

After a reverse stock split, PenUltimate stockholders exchanged their 16.7 million shares of common stock for 250,000 shares of PenWare. PenWare shareholders also receive 112,500 shares of PenUltimate's Series C preferred stock.
Aziz Valliani, former CEO of PenWare, was named CEO PenUltimate and president of PenWare, which is now a wholly owned unit of PenUltimate.
